Thanks for the replies Peter, Colin.

> As for the repositories, there is n=
o central location for all
variations of
> SharpNEAT, but then that's the b=
eauty of open source in that you can
just
> release your own version withou=
t having to get the approval of the
original
> author or authors. 

I was a=
sking about a subversion repository or equivalent for the
project more from=
 the point of view of accessing existing and
submitting new patches (be the=
y bug fixes, speed improvements or major
branching extensions like parallel=
/hyper neat).  The beauty of a
source control system is that you do not hav=
e to take time out someday
to merge bits of the other releases into the mai=
n code, anybody could
instead apply patches against the main release or rel=
ease patches
anywhere.
No problem that there isn't one at the moment of cou=
rse, It was just
to confirm so I didn't go off modifying an out of date ver=
sion :)...



--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Colin Green" <locster01@...> wr=
ote:
>
> Hi all,
> 
> In response to the original question I think the sugg=
estion given
was about
> right - override the population evaluator class be=
ing used
> (e.gSingleFilePopulationEvaluator) and get it to evaluate agains=
t the
> validation
> cases and set the SearchCompleted flag when the valida=
tion set
> fitness starts to fall (or falls for several generations in a ro=
w,
or falls
> below N% of the best validation score).
> 
> As for the repos=
itories, there is no central location for all
variations of
> SharpNEAT, bu=
t then that's the beauty of open source in that you can
just
> release your=
 own version without having to get the approval of the
original
> author or=
 authors. I don't think there's any major difference
between the
> threee v=
ersions mentioned, apart from if you want distributed
execution use
> Wesle=
y's codeplex, for CPPNs use David's version available from UCF,
> otherwise=
 use my original release (that they were spawned from) over at
> sourceforg=
e.
> 
> Ultimately I hope to merge bits of the other releases into my code =
base.
> 
> Cheers,
> 
> Colin.

upport for

ten
around to

m fairly
certain

you mentioned.

w to NEAT, I begun by searching around for
SharpNeat

 there are at least three different implementations:

eplex and a version supporting HyperNeat/.NET

e the SharpNeat project is maintained and/or the

ersions available?

> > > --- In neat=

> > <pandrews@> w=
rote:
> > > >
> > > > In the recent thread "New To NEAT - A few Newbie Ques=
tions"
Ken wrote:
> > > >
> > > > >What you do is evaluate each
> > > > >ge=
neration on the training set and test the champion of each
> > > > >generat=
ion on the validation set. When the validation scores
start
> > > > >going =
down, you stop evolution.
> > > >
> > > > I am using SharpNEAT and am new t=
o all this so I would
appreciate a
> > > > little more detail.
> > > >
> > =
> > I have implemented two interface, IExperiment and
INetworkEvaluator.
> =
> > > Neither interface appears to have any concept of a generation
or of a=

> > > > champion. It looks to me like I might want/need to subclass
> > > =
> SingleFilePopulationEvaluator so that I can override
> > > > EvaluatePopu=
lation. I can then call the superclass'
EvaluatePopulation
> > > > and afte=
r it completes do my validation testing on the
> > > > EvolutionAlgorithm's=
 BestGenome. I was then thinking
> > > > that once I wished to stop evoluti=
on, I could set the
> > > > EvolutionAlgorithm SearchCompleted boolean. Fin=
ally, I can modify
> > > > SharpNeatGui's SearchThread to check the ea's Se=
archCompleted
flag so
> > > > that the thread will stop.
> > > >
> > > > Am=
 I on the right track here? How have others handled
cross-validation
> > > =
> and prevention of over-fitting?

eter
